questions.question: Which of the following is the null hypothesis?
choices: H₀: μ = 0
H₀: μ ≠ 0
H₀: μ > 0
H₀: μ < 0

questions.question: In simple linear regression, what does the slope of the regression line represent?
questions.chosen_answer: The predicted value of the dependent variable for a given value of the independent variable
questions.correct_answer: The change in the dependent variable for a one-unit change in the independent variable
choices: The predicted value of the dependent variable for a given value of the independent variable
The change in the dependent variable for a one-unit change in the independent variable
The intercept of the regression line
The variation in the dependent variable

questions.question: What is the p-value in hypothesis testing?
questions.chosen_answer: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
questions.correct_answer: The probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as the observed result, assuming the null hypothesis is true
choices: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
The significance level of the test
The probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as the observed result, assuming the null hypothesis is true
The critical value used to reject the null hypothesis

questions.question: Which of the following represents a Type I error?
questions.chosen_answer: Failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false
questions.correct_answer: Rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
choices: Rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true
Failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is true
Rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false
Failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false

questions.question: What is the standard deviation a measure of?
questions.chosen_answer: The average value of a data set
questions.correct_answer: The spread or dispersion of a data set
choices: The average value of a data set
The range of a data set
The spread or dispersion of a data set
The variance of a data set

questions.question: If the correlation coefficient between two variables is -1, what does this imply?
questions.chosen_answer: There is no linear relationship between the variables
questions.correct_answer: The variables have a perfect negative linear relationship
choices: The variables have a perfect positive linear relationship
The variables have a perfect negative linear relationship
There is no linear relationship between the variables
The variables are independent of each other

questions.question: What does a confidence interval represent?
questions.chosen_answer: The range of possible values for a population parameter
questions.correct_answer: The range of values that is likely to contain the population parameter with a certain level of confidence
choices: The range of possible values for a population parameter
The range of values that is likely to contain the population parameter with a certain level of confidence
The range of values that is equally distributed around the sample mean
The significance level of the test

questions.question: In a normal distribution, what percentage of the data falls within one standard deviation of the mean?
What is the central limit theorem?
questions.chosen_answer: The probability distribution of a sample mean is approximately normal for large sample sizes, regardless of the population's distribution
questions.correct_answer: The sampling distribution of the sample mean approaches a normal distribution as the sample size increases, regardless of the population's distribution
choices: The sample mean is always normally distributed
The sampling distribution of the sample mean approaches a normal distribution as the sample size increases, regardless of the population's distribution
The probability distribution of a sample mean is approximately normal for large sample sizes, regardless of the population's distribution
The sample size does not affect the normality of the distribution

questions.question: What is the purpose of an ANOVA test?
questions.chosen_answer: To test for relationships between two variables
questions.correct_answer: To compare the means of three or more groups
choices: To test for relationships between two variables
To compare the means of two groups
To compare the means of three or more groups
To test for independence between categorical variables
